column2: "Oh, <%me>. Fancy meeting you here."
"I'm uh, on a personal search for information. I thought it might be here..."
"...Hate to break it to you, but I don't think the information you're looking for is here, Theodore."
"M-Maria? How do you know what I'm looking for?"
"I can see it in your eyes. You're searching for a way to return to being a Newman."
"But what's wrong with being a Dewman? You won't die from it, and you're far stronger than before."
"...Sometimes, I see this very sad look in Ulc's eyes."
"I never saw that when I was still a Newman."
"Ulc, huh? But she didn't so much as bat an eye when she learned of ARKS' dark secrets..."
"And besides, I'm different... I acquired this, like a disease."
"So... I'm not surprised that people think I'm creepy."
"...Ah, I get it. That girl knows Mr Pessimistic here inside-out..."
"Listen, kiddo. Do you know why CASTS were made?"
"Uh... well... it's a way to extend the life of someone born with a frail body."
"Heh... are you stupid? The Photoners didn't go out of their way to create a race for that."
"Sure, the technology can be used to save lives, but... only if they have the affinity."
"CAST tech is reserved for people whose bodies cannot withstand their innate Photon affinity."
"I'm sure you know, like everyone, that ARKS is knee deep in genetic manipulation."
"Sometimes, or I should say more often than not, we see kids born with tremendous ability."
"That ability unfortunately proves too much for their bodies to handle."
"Once it's certain their bodies won't last, they are transferred to a mechanical one, to make the best use of it."
"There is in fact a decay in ability because of the procedure, but it's still plenty to utilize on the front lines."
"And that's where CASTs came from. Get the point?"
"Time for question number two: Theodore, do you think CASTs are creepy?"
"...No, not at all."
"And you're just like us. So what's the problem?"
"That girl knew you'd be hung up on this, and has been worried about you the whole time."
"If you've got the time to waste on this, then better to spend it by her side."
"It doesn't matter how strong, or how talented... it matters what kind of person you are."
"Is that clear? If so, then get your ass back on deck!"
"Could that wishy-washy kid be any more clueless about a girl's heart? Makes me want to lecture him every time."
"Well, he's still leagues ahead of the the strongest blockhead in the universe."
"Who? Haha...I'll let you figure that out yourself."
